channel.title: More hosting problems
channel.description: Ok, I really don't know why this is so hard. I have a linksys router, and I've disabled my firewall and it's firewall, I've opened the port 43594 on almost everything I have, and I've pinged it. The weird thing about that is all 4 ping packets get lost. Anyways, what the heck is going on?

item.title: More hosting problems
item.dc:creator: @tgp1994 tgp1994
item.description:
@tgp1994 wrote:

Sorry for not replying. Ok, so you will help me? Bundles of thanks. Oh, if talking doesn’t help, do you think you could use remote assistance?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 11, 2008, 06:30:13 PM[/size][hr]BUMP
Also, I noticed that someone had added no-ip into their router’s config, should I add it too? Also, if I have to, what IP does it run on?

Read full topic

item.description:

Im at my girlfriend s house right now but when i get home i’ll see how mine is set up

item.title: More hosting problems
item.dc:creator: @tgp1994 tgp1994
item.description:
@tgp1994 wrote:

Ok, I really don’t know why this is so hard. I have a linksys router, and I’ve disabled my firewall and it’s firewall, I’ve opened the port 43594 on almost everything I have, and I’ve pinged it. The weird thing about that is all 4 ping packets get lost. Anyways, what the heck is going on?
